verses.roman:
etad dhārayamāṇas tu
yaṁ yaṁ paśyati cakṣuṣā
padā vā saṁspṛśet sadyaḥ
sādhvasāt sa vimucyate

synonyms: etat—this; dhārayamāṇaḥ—a person employing; tu—but; yam yam—whomever; paśyati—he sees; cakṣuṣā—by his eyes; padā—by his feet; vā—or; saṁspṛśet—may touch; sadyaḥ—immediately; sādhvasāt—from all fear; saḥ—he; vimucyate—is freed.
translation: If one employs this armor, whomever he sees with his eyes or touches with his feet is immediately freed from all the above-mentioned dangers.
